snippet: The administration abruptly announced a delay in the mandate that larger employers cover their workers, postponing the effective date beyond next year’s midterm elections.
abstract: Obama administration abruptly announces a delay, until 2015, in health care law's  mandate that larger employers provide coverage for their workers or pay penalties; decision postpones effective date of law beyond 2014 midterm elections.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: The administration abruptly announced a delay in the mandate that larger employers cover their workers, postponing the effective date beyond next year’s midterm elections.

headline.main: Crucial Rule Is Delayed a Year for Obama’s Health Law
headline.print_headline: Crucial Mandate Delayed A Year For Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
